H0.text: It was once underwater, as evidenced by fossils of sea animals found in a cave in Arkansas.

H1.text: It was once much warmer, as indicated by fossils of sea animals found in a cave in Arkansas.

H2.text: It has become a rockier place, as the discovery of fossils of sea animals in a cave in Arkansas shows that the area was once underwater.

H3.text: It has changed little from then, because fossils of sea animals were found in a cave in Arkansas.

A4.text: Classic paleoecology uses data from fossils and subfossils to reconstruct the ecosystems of the past.

A5.text: The fossil or physical records are inherently incomplete - the geologic record is selective and some environments are more likely to be preserved than others.
